sub_title: SAP Technology Consultant | S/4HANA transformation | SAP on Azure | Passionate SAP Solution Manager consultant
summary:
>>> See section licenses & certifications for achieved SAP and Microsoft certificates <<<
>>> See section accomplishments for attended courses and recent projects <<<

Due to the increasing complexity of solution landscapes and the more integrated and comprehensive the solutions in a modern SAP landscape are, the greater the need for a holistic approach to application lifecycle management. For this reason I am passionate about the SAP ALM product SAP Solution Manager and Focused Run. I believe in the added value of them during the complete lifecycle of SAP solutions.

Modern (SAP)solutions do not stop at the on-premise border. Cloud solutions are part of SAP landscapes nowadays. Knowledge about cloud solutions (SAAS/PAAS/IAAS) are no luxury and necessity to keep businesses running. That's why I gained knownledge about Microsofts cloud solution and in particular SAP workloads in Azure.

Integrated (cloud)solutions also requires an as per design security approach. This applies certainly also for a central Solution Manager or Focused Run system and therefore I encourage applying transport layer security and encryption by default for all used application protocols (SAP or generic).

Despite the extended support from SAP for their Business Suite (R/3) until 2030, migration to the successor product S/4HANA will be commonplace next years. I am certified to migrate to S/4HANA. Let's do the migration together!

With a strong focus on quality and customer satisfaction and 20 years experience I have in-depth SAP knowledge but also a broad interest in adjacent topics.

Mainly working in projects (installation, upgrade/update, migration/copy) and innovations (refresh automation, Focused Run implementation, ...) in past years. From 3.1I to S/4HANA and everything in between :-). From Oracle to SAP HANA and all the the other DB vendors. See section experience and projects to have a complete overview.

projects.title: Implement central SAP ASE management system
projects.description:
In modern SAP landscapes the SAP ASE database is nowadays an important database flavour next to SAP HANA. In our customer base these ASE databases are managed centrally via the Solution Manager DBACockpit. Due to the replacement of Solution Manager by Focused Run some of these Solution Manager systems are decommissioned in near future. To guarantee the support of SAP ASE a new system is positioned in the KPN tooling landscape. Goal of this new central system is to support all customer ASE databases. Foundation is a SAP Netweaver 7.50 ABAP running on SAP ASE. Because of the central character of the system security aspects are applicable.

Network and transport layer security aspects:
Communication crosses different network zones (KPN tooling and several customer VLAN's) so on transport layer packet filtering is applied. Only the necessary service is available in one direction.  Traffic is encrypted on transport layer by enabling TLS on SAP ASE database server. Via this transport layer protocol the ODBC application protocol is secured. That is: all database connections that are made in the central DBACockpit are encrypted.

- Technical design is made.

Stay tuned!

contributors.headline: SAP Technology Consultant | S/4HANA transformation | SAP on Azure | Passionate SAP Solution Manager consultant

projects.title: Implement SAP Solution Manager 7.2
projects.description:
Implementation of SAP Solution Manager 7.2 in conjuction with SAP Focused Run 2.0. The goal of this project is running SAP Solution Manager in parallel with SAP Focused Run where the latter is the leading Application Lifecycle Management solution in the internal SAP demo landscape. Solution Manager operates with all functionality in parallel with Focused Run with respect for single point of truth concept. 
Latest Solution Manager innovations applied: Outside Discovery is executed via SAP Host Agent instead of Diagnostics Agent. Outside Discovery and DataSupplier payload is directly delivered to LMDB bypassing the SLD. This significantly decrease administration and improves landscape descriptions drastically. CA Introscope is shared with FRUN

Network and communication security aspects applied:
Communication channels are secured (client/server authentication, integrity an encryption) for network traffic in between network zones with transport layer security. International standard application protocols HTTP and P4 are secured via TLS while SAP application protocol RFC and SAPdiag are secured via SNC.
Solution Manager operates exclusively secure for both internal and external communication. Components ICM and MS are HTTPS only for ABAP and Java. RFC traffic between Solution Manager and Managed Systems is secured via SNC.
Diagnostics Agents are connected encryped to AS Java with server validation enabled.

- Installation SAP HANA 2.0 multi-tenant (ABAP tenant en Java tenant) to prevent MCOD layout.
- Update SAP HANA 2.0 SPS
- Installation SAP Solution Manager 7.2 - ABAP & Java
- Update SAP Solution Manager SPS10 - ABAP & Java
- Installation CA Introscope
- Support Hub configuration
- Configure Solution Manager (System Preparation, Infrastructure Preparation, Basis Configuration)
- Managed System Configuration

Techniques / keywords:
TLS 1.2, server/client authentication, CA signed and self-signed certificates, key-pair exchange, sapgenpse, CommonCryptoLib, Ciphers.

contributors.headline: SAP Technology Consultant | S/4HANA transformation | SAP on Azure | Passionate SAP Solution Manager consultant

projects.title: Implement Solution Manager | encrypt more communication channnels on application level
projects.description:
During the configuration of Solution Manager (see the previous project) I have already enabled transport layer security protocols TLS and SNC. Via these encryption protocols all standard application protocols (like http and SAPdiag) were already secured. This means that Solution Manager already used secure services for both internal and external communication. That means indeed that no unsecure services were defined.

However some communication channels were still left unsecure. In succession of the Solution Manager configuration all left-over application protocols were made secure. Because transport layer security was already enabled this wasn't a big deal anymore.

- All RFC's from and to the Managed Systems are now encrypted via SNC.
- The SAP transport infrastructure (TMS) RFC's are now encrypted via SNC.
- The application protocol ODBC in the communication channel AS ABAP towards the SAP HANA database (ABAP tenant) is now encrypted via TLS.
- The database connections from Solution Manager towards the Managed Databases (for the execution of the database extractors) are now encrypted via TLS.
- The application protocol JDBC in the communication channel AS Java towards the SAP HANA database (Java tenant) is now encrypted via TLS.

Of course on the transport layer TLS protocol version 1.2 is enforced by following the SAP guidelines with respect for the KPN security policy. On network level packet filtering is applied when passing a network zone.

Any left-over now on application level? In my opinion no but feel free to trigger me.

Techniques / keywords:
HANA 2.0, HANA certificate collections, TLS1.2, ODBC/JDBC encryption, RFCSEC.

contributors.headline: SAP Technology Consultant | S/4HANA transformation | SAP on Azure | Passionate SAP Solution Manager consultant

projects.title: Migration ERP landscape to RHEL7
projects.description:
For one of the KPN customers a migration of the ERP landscape (MaxDB) to new RHEL 7 virtual servers is done. Some aspects that must be taken into account: SAProuter is also positioned on the old ERP servers so SAProuter must also be migrated. A lot of customer connections are routed via the SAProuter so a decent strategy is made to migrate SAProuter smoothly. Also SAML (cross-side SSO) is active and must be available after the ERP migration (incoming traffic is routed via SAP WDISP). ERP also uses ADS functionality and this ADS functionality is deployed on an old SAP Netweaver Java that will be decommissioned, For this gap a new SAP Netweaver Java is deployed.

Network and transport layer security aspects:
SAProuters involved are deployed in different network zones so new firewall rules are made. Traffic passing the network borders are secured via SNC encryption.

- Implementation new SAProuter on management node
- Configure transport layer encryption via SNC between involved SAProuters and re-configure connections
- Homogeneous System copy of ERP via backup/restore MaxDB (SWPM)
- Implementation SAP Netweaver 7.50 Java with product instance ADS (SWPM)
- Update SAP Netweaver Java with latest SPS including Java patches (SUM)
- Configure SAP Netweaver Java and ADS including migration of the ADS connections in ERP

Techniques/keywords: transport layer security SNC, SAProuter, ADS, homogeneous copy, SAML.

Done in given timeframe with expected quality. I like a satisfied customer!

contributors.headline: SAP Technology Consultant | S/4HANA transformation | SAP on Azure | Passionate SAP Solution Manager consultant

projects.title: SAP refresh automation | integrate SAP HANA restore/recovery via Commvault
projects.description:
SAP refreshes are automated with the copy solution of partner Empirius. This reduced the time needed to refresh a system significantly. The procedure is a 3 step process until now: pre-processing, manual restore and post-processing. Wouldn't it be great to make it a one step procedure and just schedule the refresh during the night? I think it is :-)
Main focus was the integration of the SAP HANA restore in the copy tooling by means of a user exit. The integration and troubleshooting was done together with software vendor Empirius.

- Create a plan to integrate SAP HANA restore
- Collect cross-side restore details at KPN side (what to automate)
- Discuss automation details with software vendor
- implement the solution provided by software vendor
- Test, adjust and troubleshoot the provided solution together with software vendor

The result is working one-step procedure (without any human intervention) to refresh a SAP system based on SAP HANA. Within just 2 hours! You can't believe until you see it happen :-). Next level refreshing!

Next target is supporting the one-step procedure with more database vendors with first focus on SAP ASE and MSSQL. This will be scheduled later in 2021 together with software vendor Empirius.

contributors.headline: SAP Technology Consultant | S/4HANA transformation | SAP on Azure | Passionate SAP Solution Manager consultant

projects.title: Implement SAP Focused Run 2.0
projects.description:
Implementation of Focused Run 2.0. After a successful Proof Of Concept with former release Focused Run 1.0 a 2-tier Focused Run 2.0 landscape is implemented. The development system is intented to serve the KPN demo landscape while the production system serves the KPN customers.
In the KPN demo landscape several systems types (ABAP, Java, SAP ASE, SAP HANA) are located, both on-premise and in the Azure cloud. Also a Solution Manager system is located in the KPN demo landscape and from Focused Run perspective this Solution Manager system is Managed. Focused Run is has the managing role and is therefore the lead Lifecycle Management solution. This means that KPN customers are administered via Focused Run instead of via Solution Manager for all common functionality (an analysis is done in the POC phase), however both solutions can operate in parallel. The optional SLD Router is implemented with the aim that SLD payload can be routed flexible. Outside Discovery payload is routed to LMDB directly.

Network and communication security aspects:
Communication in-between the Focused Run infra and towards customers are crossing network segments. A decent traffic flow design is made and TLS is used to secure the transport layer (TLS 1.2).

- Installation SAP HANA 2.0
- Update SAP HANA 2.0 SPS
- Installation / upgrade SAP Webdispatcher
- Installation Focused Run 2.0 FP00
- Support Hub configuration (multi-customers)
- Configuration Focused Run
- Simple System Integration (SSI) of KPN demo landscape and the first KPN customer 
- Upgrade to Focused Run FP03
- Educate two colleagues to start customer onboarding

Techniques / keywords:
Functional design, technical design, TLS 1.2, server authentication, client authentication, CA signed and self-signed certificates, SAN, key-pair exchange, sapgenpse, CommonCryptoLib, Ciphers, SSO, STRUST Identities.

projects.title: Upgrade SAP BW including SAP Business Planning and Consolidation (BPC)
projects.description:
For one of the KPN customers the BW landscape is upgraded from product version 7.30 to product version 7.50. SAP BPC is upgraded from version 10.0 to 10.1. The BW systems in scope are ABAP stack only. 2-tier landscape.

- Create a decent Maintenance Plan (SAP Maintenance Planner) including stack with latest SPS. Taken into account are the BPC upgrade to 10.1 and the compatibility of the GRC addon with GRC server.
- Upgrade SAP Netweaver ABAP BW to 7.50
- Post upgrade (including reconfiguration of the BW Managed Systems in SAP Solution Manager)

Done in given timeframe with expected quality. I like a satisfied customer!

projects.title: SAP refresh automation
projects.description:
How to support around 100 refreshes a year in the context of re-shoring SAP activities back to the Netherlands. That's a challenge!
To make it even more fun some extra the requirements:
- Supported stacks: ABAP, Java, Dual-stacks
- Supported DB-vendors: all (..)
- Supported OS: Linux, Solaris, Windows
- Supported SAP versions: as much as possible.

A SAP refresh can distinguish three phases:
1) Pre-process: save technical settings of target system
2) Restore: restore/recover source database
3) Post-process: restore of saved settings to target.

In co-operation with Empirius GmbH their BlueCopy suite is implemented and pre-process, post-process is automated. For restore Commvault is used.
The result:
- Two step procedure (restore done manually)
- All requirements are met
- High quality refreshes with satisfied customers (strong reduction of post incidents)
- Strong reduction of human resources necessary
- Done is a fraction of time (hours instead of days)

Tasks and challenges faced:
- Adjust software to specific circumstances. Debug software together with the software vendor
- Request software adaption / feature requests
- MCOD designs (multiple schema's in one database)
- Customize software (homebrew Tablesets, SQLsets)
- Standardize the refresh procedure (both KPN and customer side)

Used techniques: ssh, powershell remoting
Role: lead consultant

contributors.headline: SAP Technology Consultant | S/4HANA transformation | SAP on Azure | Passionate SAP Solution Manager consultant
